docs.snippet: In painting the perils that could topple his mighty Microsoft empire, William H. Gates likes to invoke the theoretical young programmer toiling in obscurity somewhere, at work on the software project that could overtake the industry-dominating Win...
docs.abstract: Little-noticed international project is intended to let PC users run their normally Windows-dependent programs on Linux--a free operating system; Alexandre Julliard, 28-year-old Swiss programmer coordinating project, and his devotees would like to overthrow Microsoft's hegemony; project is known as Wine, short for Windows emulator; emulation in computer industry refers to ability of one type of software to imitate software of different technical standard so completely that difference is virtually invisible to user; so far most Windows programs run only partly--if at all--with Wine, and using it still requires computer geek's special skills; each incremental Wine improvement offers evidence of growing strength of so-called open source software movement, in which original programmer's instructions are freely shared and subsequent program development takes place on volunteer basis; photo (M)

docs.abstract: Raisio Group of Finland has not been able to get its cholesterol-reducing margarine, Benecol, to US market because McNeil Consumer Products, its American partner, lost precious time trying to get FDA to approve Benecol as a dietary supplement rather than a food; now Uilever has a cholesterol-fighting margarine of its own ready for market, and Kellogg plans a whole line cholesterol-reducing products; graph shows rise and fall of Raisio stock price (M)

headline.main: Rocky Path To Market For Edible Foe Of Cholesterol

docs.snippet: MANY business owners are aware of the legal and financial perils of sexual harassment in the workplace and have taken steps to help prevent it. Co-op and condominium associations, however, lawyers say, have generally failed to guard against the po...
docs.abstract: Your Home column notes that co-op and condominium assns generally fail to guard against possibility of lawsuits over sexual harassment claims, even though buildings may have number of employees; legal ramifications discussed (S)

headline.main: Co-ops and Liability for Harassment
